Try it

cURL

Python

JavaScript

PHP

Go

Java

Copy

```
curl --request POST \
  --url https://app.chatwoot.com/api/v1/accounts/{account_id}/portals/{id}/articles \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --header 'api_access_token: <api-key>' \
  --data '{
  "title": "Article Title",
  "slug": "article-title",
  "position": 1,
  "content": "This is the content of the article",
  "description": "This is the description of the article",
  "category_id": 1,
  "author_id": 1,
  "associated_article_id": 2,
  "status": 1,
  "locale": "en",
  "meta": {
    "tags": [\
      "article_name"\
    ],
    "title": "article title",
    "description": "article description"
  }
}'
```

#### Authorizations

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#authorization-api-access-token)

api\_access\_token

string

header

required

This token can be obtained by visiting the profile page or via rails console. Provides access to endpoints based on the user permissions levels. This token can be saved by an external system when user is created via API, to perform activities on behalf of the user.

#### Path Parameters

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#parameter-account-id)

account\_id

integer

required

The numeric ID of the account

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#parameter-id)

id

string

required

The slug identifier of the portal

#### Body

application/json

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-title)

title

string

The title of the article

Example:

`"Article Title"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-slug)

slug

string

The slug of the article

Example:

`"article-title"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-position)

position

integer

article position in category

Example:

`1`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-content)

content

string

The text content.

Example:

`"This is the content of the article"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-description)

description

string

The description of the article

Example:

`"This is the description of the article"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-category-id)

category\_id

integer

The category id of the article

Example:

`1`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-author-id)

author\_id

integer

The author agent id of the article

Example:

`1`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-associated-article-id)

associated\_article\_id

integer

To associate similar articles to each other, e.g to provide the link for the reference.

Example:

`2`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-status)

status

integer

The status of the article. 0 for draft, 1 for published, 2 for archived

Example:

`1`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-locale)

locale

string

The locale of the article

Example:

`"en"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/help-center/add-a-new-article#body-meta)

meta

object

Use for search

Example:

```
{
  "tags": ["article_name"],
  "title": "article title",
  "description": "article description"
}
```
